Title: Document Management Solution
Description: Ofwat requires the successful Supplier to remove Ofwat's boxes, maps, files, catalogue data and metadata ('Material') from the current contractor's storage within 2 weeks of the contract being signed e.g. signed on 8th May and Material transferred by 22nd May 2019 unless both parties agree otherwise. OFWAT will agree to an extension where the current supplier (Storetec) cannot operate within this timescale. The successful Supplier must organise their workload to ensure the Material is collected by this date. The Material must be processed by the successful Supplier and accepted into suitable storage facilities that have been identified, visited and agreed with Ofwat. The Supplier has stated that storage will be in Coventry. The Supplier must take their location into account when advising on the service level that they can provide e.g. delivery times to Birmingham and London for both physical and digital data. Please also note that major roadworks are ongoing around both locations. There is no parking available at either the London or Birmingham office. There is on street parking but the successful Supplier will need to make their own arrangements. The successful Supplier must provide details of how catalogue data will be exported along with all existing metadata to the new system. The process must include what checks will be made to ensure no data is lost and that there is a retrieval system for corrupted files. It is essential that the successful Supplier can accept and use the existing bar codes and maintain the link to the relevant catalogue data currently held by the incumbent Supplier or suggest a suitable no or low cost alternative. Catalogue systems must accept and retrieve Welsh language entries. Digital data must be stored and made available securely in line with GDPR requirements and industry best practice. The successful Supplier needs to have suitable systems in place to store digital data securely. It is desirable that the successful Supplier can provide regular checks to ensure no data is lost, that software formats are still accessible.  The successful Supplier must have the capacity to scan documents in accordance with relevant standards and manage increasing levels of digital data, as required. A service level agreement will be required providing the terms and costs for the retrieval and storage of digital data as well as physical records. The successful Supplier must demonstrate that the scanning process from receipt of documents to destruction creates digital records that are BS 10008:2014 compliant. The successful Supplier must expect regular audits of this by the Customer.  All scanning must be done by the successful Supplier and must not be sub-contracted to a third party supplier without Ofwat's permission.The potential for scanning may include anything up to and including A0 maps in bound books.

Organisation Name: HealthTrust Europe LLP (HTE) acting as agent for the University Hospitals of Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust ("UHCW")
Title: Framework Agreement for the supply of Document Storage, Scanning and Digitalisation Solutions
Description:
The Tender is to establish a Framework Agreement for the supply of Total Document Storage, Scanning and Digitalisation Solutions. The Framework Agreement will be split into three lots:
- Lot 1 -Total Document Storage, Scanning and Digitalisation Solutions
- Lot 2 - Document Storage, Retrieval and Destruction Services
- Lot 3 - Document Scanning, EDRMS, Digitalisation and related services


The duration of the Framework Agreement will be a maximum of four (4) years; two (2) years initial period with the option to extend for two (2) periods of 12 months.


The Framework Agreement will:
- Offer choice to the NHS, other Public Sector and Private Sector organisations with suppliers capable of meeting current and future requirements in line with digitalisation transformation plans.
- Provide competitive pricing and be an attractive option for NHS, other Public Sector and Private Sector organisations.
- Enable cost reductions for the NHS, other Public Sector and Private Sector organisations by working collaboratively to facilitate strategic change programmes.

Title: 390_18 Document Management Solutions
Description:
ESPO is seeking to establish a framework agreement with a number of suppliers for the provision of scanning, storage, retrieval and associated services. The key aim of the framework will be to promote efficiencies and cost savings.

An eAuction process may be used to award subsequent call off contracts following the reopening of competition among the parties to the Framework Agreement.

To reflect the different types of document management services required, the framework will be divided into following lots:

• Lot 1 - Electronic document scanning services and software solutions
• Lot 2 - Document storage, retrieval and associated services
• Lot 3 - Total document management solutions
• Lot 4 - Enhanced handling and security requirements

The framework agreement has the option to extend for up to a further 24 months. The total estimated value stated includes the option period.

As a Central Purchasing Body as defined by the EU Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU, the Framework Agreement is open for use by Public Bodies (defined https://www.espo.org/ESPO/media/Documents/FAQs/ESPO-s_powers_to_trade__website_-2016-12-22.pdf) that also fall into one of the following classifications of user throughout all administrative regions of the UK: Local Authorities; Educational Establishments (including Academies); Central Government Departments and Agencies; Police, Fire & Rescue and Coastguard Emergency Services; NHS and HSC Bodies, including Ambulance Services; Registered Charities; Registered Social Landlords; or any public body established by or under the Scotland Act 1998 or any Act of the Scottish Parliament.  Details of the classification of end user establishments and geographical areas is available on: http://www.espo.org/About-us-%281%29/FAQs/Legal
